dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Universal logo completes itself, we begin to slowly push in on the East Coast of the United States. The camera glides down through the atmosphere, through the clouds, closer and closer, until we begin to see large patches of snow covering the upper coastline. It's winter. We continue to push in, until we arrive at one small suburban neighborhood. Over the push-in, we hear the following narration, delivered by Patrick Stewart.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It has been said that magic vanished from our world a long time ago. And that humanity can no longer fulfill its desires through the power of wishes. To those who have lost the wondrous vision of childhood eyes, submitted here is the story of a little boy, and a magical Christmas wish that changed his life forever.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It began in 1985, in a town just outside Boston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a GROUP OF KIDS laughing and tossing snowballs at each other in the street.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was Christmas Eve, and all the children were in high spirits. That special time of year when Boston children gather together and beat up the Jewish kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another little kid walks out of his house with a sled, and starts walking up the street. One of the snowball- throwing kids points at the sled kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Greenbaum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Jesus' birthday tomorrow! You know what I'm gonna get him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W...what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2 CONTINUED:  KID #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fist in your fuckin' face!  GREENBAUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would Jesus want that?  KID #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids all chase Greenbaum up the street, and tackle him. Another boy, JOHN BENNETT (about 8 years old, shy and innocent-looking) approaches the melee.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But there was one child who wasn't in such good spirits. Little John Bennett. That one boy in every neighborhood who just has a tough time making friends.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys, can I play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids all look at him.  KID #1/#2/#3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here! / Get outta here, Bennett! / Get lost, Bennett!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jewish kid, his face bloodied, looks angrily at John.  GREENBAUM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Bennett, get outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids go back to beating up Greenbaum, as John sadly walks back toward his house.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: John longed with all his heart for that one true friend that he could call his own. And he knew that if he ever found that friend, he would never let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sadly sits by his window with his chin in his hands, looking outside. John'S POV - We see the other kids all playing in the snow: building snowmen, throwing snowballs, etc. At one point, a BLACK KID IN A WHEELCHAIR wheels up. The other kids welcome him with open arms, and he immediately joins in the fun.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, as it does every year, Christmas morning finally came. (MORE) (CONTINUED) 3 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All the children were opening their gifts with holiday glee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LITTLE GIRL opens a present as her parents look on, smiling. Inside is a My Little Pony. She smiles with delight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LITTLE BOY opens a present as HIS PARENTS look on, smiling. Inside is a G.I. Joe Hovercraft. The boy is overjoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER LITTLE BOY opens a present as his parents look on smiling. Inside is a "Darth Vader head" action figure cas The boy opens it up, revealing that it's full of "Star Wa action figures. The boy jumps around ecstatically.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And for little John Bennett, Christmas Day brought a very special new arrival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits amidst unwrapped gifts. We see him opening a present. Inside is a plush, adorable-looking teddy bear. The boy holds it with delight.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIS MOM AND DAD hug him.  JOHN'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess Santa paid attention to how good you were this year, huh?  JOHN'S MOM (KISSING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hugs the teddy bear. It makes a cutesy, high- pitched "I wuv you" sound. John gasps with delight.  (CONTINUED) 4 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He talks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John giggles happily, squeezing the bear to make it talk, as his mom and dad exchange a smile.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna name you Teddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits on the floor watching the 1980 film "Flash Gordon" on TV. He eats Twizzlers with Ted sitting next to him. Occasionally he gives Ted a "bite."

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: John became instantly attached to Teddy. There was something about that bear that made him feel as if he finally had a friend with whom he could share his deepest secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Teddy... can I tell you something nobody knows?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy looks back at him, expressionless.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week, my mom and dad took me to the park for a picnic. And they have this duck pond there, and... when nobody was looking, I pooped in my hand and threw it at a duck. Was that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squeezes Ted, who once again makes the "I wuv you" sound.  JOHN (CONT'D) (HUGGING HIM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Teddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets into bed with the teddy bear, and snuggles with it.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... I wish you could really talk to me. Because then we could be best friends forever and ever.   (CONTINUED) 5 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John drifts off to sleep. The camera moves toward the window, and drifts outside. It pulls back from the house slowly.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now, if there's one thing you can be sure of... it's that nothing is more powerful than a young boy's wish. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except an Apache helicopter. An Apache helicopter has machine guns and missiles. It is an unbelievably impressive complement of weaponry. An absolute death machine. Well, as it turned out, John picked the perfect night to make a wish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pivots around to face the sky. We see the snow falling from moonlit clouds. At the center of the clouds, there is a small patch of open air through which we can see stars. Suddenly, a shooting star whizzes by through the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOWLY PUSH IN on the teddy bear's face as John lies sleeping next to it.  DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house and yard are covered with snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slowly opens his eyes. He turns over to face Teddy, but we see that Teddy is no longer next to him. John bolts upright and looks around, frantically.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy? (beat, a bit more concerned) Teddy?!     (CONTINUED) 6 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks under the covers, but the bear is not there. He jumps out of bed and looks around the bed's perimeter, assuming that Teddy must have fallen off during the night. Finally, he checks underneath the bed. ANGLE FROM UNDERNEATH THE BED we see John looking around.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits up again and freezes, looking right into the camera, wide eyed. ANGLE ON JOHN'S P.O.V.: We see the face of Teddy staring right at him. Teddy blinks once.  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hug me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John yelps and stumbles back, falling over. He stares at Teddy, breathing heavily.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you... did you just talk?  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my best friend, John.  JOHN (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're alive?!  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look so surprised. You're the one who wished for it, aren't you?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I... I did wish for it.  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, here I am.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean... we get to be best friends... for real?  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For real.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forever and ever?  (CONTINUED) 7 CONTINUED:  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge grin spreads across John's face. He gets up, runs to Teddy and hugs him.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: John was just about the happiest boy in the world. And he couldn't wait to tell everyone the good news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's Dad sits at the breakfast table, reading the paper as John's Mom prepares eggs and bacon, putting it on their plates. JOHN'S MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I think we had a wonderful Christmas this year.  JOHN'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the best. (SLYLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I particularly enjoyed the gift you gave me last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John runs into the kitchen.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom! Dad! Guess what?! My teddy bear's alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's Mom and Dad look at each other and smile. JOHN'S MOM (PLAYING ALONG)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, sweetie? Well, that's exciting.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No mom, he's alive! For real! Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy walks in and stands next to John.  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merry Christmas, everybody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's Dad scrambles to his feet, knocking plates off the table. John's mom screams.  JOHN'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus H. Fuck!   (CONTINUED) 8 CONTINUED:  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's all be best friends!  JOHN'S MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god...  JOHN'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, get away from that thing! Come over here, right now!  JOHN BUT DAD--  JOHN'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John reluctantly walks over to his dad, who grabs him and protectively pulls him aside.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN'S DAD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Helen, get my gun.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, no!  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a hugging gun?  JOHN'S DAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen, get my gun, and call the police!  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Bennett. I didn't mean to scare anybody. I just wanted John and I to be friends. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Dad! I made a wish last night that Teddy was alive, and my wish came true!  JOHN'S MOM (ASTONISHED WHISPER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My god, Steve... it's a miracle. A Christmas miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at Teddy for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, it wasn't long before the story of John's little miracle was sweeping the nation. 9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see an 80's NEWSCASTER behind the news desk. A graphic of the bear is over his left shoulder.  NEWSCASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of a Boston suburb comes what is, without a doubt, the most incredible story in the history of broadcast news...  DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see an 80's FEMALE NEWSCASTER. A graphic of the bear is over her left shoulder. FEMALE NEWSCASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...young boy's stuffed animal has magically come to life for as yet unknown reasons. Scientists are stumped as to how...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a `70S SOUTHERN NEWSCASTER with a CHYRON that says "ACTION NEWS GEORGIA". He points manically at the graphic of the bear above his left shoulder.  SOUTHERN NEWSCASTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what Jesus did! Look what Jesus did! Look what Jesus did!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MALE JAPANESE NEWSCASTER and FEMALE JAPANESE NEWSCASTER sit behind the desk. Between them, at the top of the screen, is a picture of the bear.  FEMALE NEWSCASTER (SPEAKS JAPANESE FOR A FEW MOMENTS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The male newscaster turns sharply to her.  MALE NEWSCASTER (ADDRESSES HER ANGRILY IN JAPANESE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He strikes her for an unclear reason. She buries her head in her hands, in shame. 10

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Before long, Teddy had become a huge celebrity in his own right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see REAL FOOTAGE of "The Tonight Show" from the `80's, with Johnny Carson talking to Teddy, who is sitting in the guest chair (If appropriate footage is accessible, will include Teddy walking out on stage, shaking hands with Johnny and sitting down.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Teddy are in bed, under the covers with a flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But through all the fame, Teddy never forgot his very best friend, John.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (O.S., UNDER COVERS)
dialogues.text: The thunder can't get us, right?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY, (O.S., UNDER COVERS)
dialogues.text: Nope. We're thunder buddies. And the thunder knows it. We're totally safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE UNDER THE COVERS - we now see them. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy?  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, John?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you promise we'll always be together?  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another thunder clap.  TEDDY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder buddies for life.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder buddies for life. (CONTINUED) 11 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug as we PULL BACK SLOWLY, dissolving through the covers.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And that was a promise that neither one of them ever forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the following, we continue to pull back from the room to the outside of the moonlit house...

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So where are John and Teddy today? Well, let me put it this way: no matter how big a splash you make in this world, whether you're Corey Feldman, Frankie Muniz, Justin Bieber, or a talking teddy bear, eventually nobody gives a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We PAN ACROSS the Boston skyline as the opening titles roll. CUT TO various shots of the city throughout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN DOWN to the streets below: several shots of the everyday bustle of the city, then we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young John and Ted lie on the floor as they both grin at the camera, chins resting on their hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young John and Ted wave to the camera from up in a treehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NEWSWEEK MAGAZINE COVER SLIDES BY - It shows Ted shaking hands with Reagan. The headline reads: "America's Little Miracle". Smaller headlines read, "Goodbye Heart Disease, Here Comes Oat Bran!" and "The Future of Entertainment: The Laserdisc."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A US NEWS COVER SLIDES BY - It shows Ted standing in front of an American flag. The headline reads, "Ted, White, and Blue". Smaller headlines read, "Oliver North Draws the Heat" and "Will Your Town Soon Have Its Own `Robocop'?" 12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Insert existing soapbox racer bit here)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and young John blow out the candles on a birthday cake at John's ninth birthday party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larry Bird stands with young John, who has Ted standing on the top of his head. They are still nowhere near as tall as Larry. A TV GUIDE COVER SLIDES BY: It shows a smiling Ted with the headline "TV'S NEW FAVORITE GUEST STAR!" Smaller headlines read, "Inside: The Best Show You're Not Watching!" and "The Unstoppable Phil Hartman!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young John and Ted sit on the couch smiling and laughing as they watch the show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young John wears a hooded sweatshirt as he pedals his bike up the street. Ted sits in the front basket, like E.T.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON a People magazine from 1992 that reads, "UP CLOSE AND PERSONAL WITH `TERMINATOR 2's ARNOLD SCHWARZENEGGER!" Down below in smaller print it says "Plus, we talk to Ted the bear".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teenage John and Ted lean against a car. Teenage John looks indifferent and a bit jaded now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's high school graduation.   (CONTINUED) 13 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON A TV - The nightly news is in progress. A news anchor addresses the camera. A graphic next to her reads "FORMER CELEBRITY BUSTED AT AIRPORT", with an unflattering photo of Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Ted getting hauled away by security. A caption below reads "Ted caught with mushrooms at airport security". He's putting up a bit of a fight, and gives the "finger" to the camera (the finger is pixilated).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see 20 year-old John sitting on his bed, laughing. Ted sits by his side, also laughing at the incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Insert existing "Phantom Menace" bit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Insert existing Chuck E. Cheese bit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON A FACEBOOK PAGE FOR JOHN BENNETT: PAN DOWN to the status indicator. It reads, "In a Relationship With Lori Collins." An arrow clicks on her name, going to her page. On her wall, it reads "Lori has added 3 new photos in the album Mobile Uploads".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and John smile as Lori holds a big stuffed bear that John has won for her at a booth. Ted stands nearby, arms crossed, with a deep, disapproving scowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the photo, presumably taken by John, Lori stands laughing as Ted stands behind her (standing on something) covering her eyes with his paws. 14

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori are set for a trail ride. They are both on horses, wearing helmets. WIDEN TO REVEAL Ted, who also wears a helmet, but rides a smiling golden retriever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, Lori, and Ted play miniature golf. Lori putts the ball, which rolls to the lip of the cup. She reacts, disappointed. Ted makes a graceful leg sweep, pushing the ball into the cup "accidentally". Lori smiles. John smiles back at her. Ted winks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Insert "Jeter sucks" bit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, Lori and Ted sit outside at a table, each holding an ice cream cone. They stare deadpan at the camera, each with a dab of ice cream on their noses, and a dab of ice cream on their upper lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori paint the apartment walls. Lori sneaks up behind John, and paints his back. John turns around and grabs her. They scuffle playfully, and then kiss. We ANGLE ON Ted, who stands on a little stepladder hammering a "Home Sweet Home" picture into the wall. He steps back, but realizes he has nailed his hand to the wall. He tugs, slips, and the ladder falls. Ted hangs there like an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, Lori, and Ted sit on the couch. All three sit with their legs crossed, faux-pretentiously raising glasses of Jorian Hill Syrah to camera in identical poses, the wine bottle on the table in front of them. 15

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see a photo Ted has taken of himself. In the background are John and Lori, playing Scrabble. Ted is in the foreground, smiling at the camera as he holds up his letters. He has spelled out the word "DOUCHE", with an extra B and G to spare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, Ted, and Lori watch a horror movie on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Insert existing John/Lori swan boat footage.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON a bong. PULL OUT TO REVEAL Ted, who inhales, his snout inside the tube. Ted sits on the sofa, and for the first time, we see Ted in his present day form: he is ratty, patched-up, and worn-looking. He has a couple stains, some small spots of exposed stuffing, and there's evidence of some half-assed sewing. It's obvious he's been around for three decades. He and John, who sits next to him, are both clearly stoned as we join them. John, for his part, looks far too comfortable in the too- worn Red Sox T-shirt he wears. He eats directly from a box of Fruity Pebbles. Reaching in for a last handful, he finds the box almost empty. He raises it to empty the remainder into his mouth, and accidentally pours Fruity Pebbles all over his face. It doesn't faze him much, though, as he brushes them off. It's quite obvious that this is a guy who has never really given up his childhood... and has never given up his teddy bear. Ted passes the bong to John.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm sayin' is Boston women are are, on the whole, a paler, uglier sort than women from the elsewheres of life.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit, what about Lori? She's hot.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's from Pennsylvania, not a Boston girl. (CONTINUED) 16 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes a hit from the bong over Ted's next line.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fact that you have to say they're not that bad means that they are that bad. They turn into drunk, half-white, half- pink monsters after 2 hours at any beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted takes a hit from the bong.  TED (CONT'D) (COUGHS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, this is weak. It's not even gettin' me high. I gotta have a talk with my weed guy.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-- It's workin' for me.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it sucks, I'm gonna have a talk with him.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't know that you wanna go to a drug dealer with complaints.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know this guy a long time. I've known him since 9/11. Remember, I was like, "Aw, shit. 9/11. I gotta get high." JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at his watch) Oh fuck, is it nine-thirty? Shit, I gotta get to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets up, and hurries into the other room to get dressed.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you mind pickin' up a bird feeder on the way home? I wanna start enjoying the beauty of birds.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Jesus, I don't know if I can drive.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive you, I feel fine. 17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see two shots of John's car driving through the city: We see John in the passenger's seat putting Visine into his eyes, with only Ted's ears and eyes showing as he drives (his paws grip the wheel). We then cut to an overhead pull-back shot as we move away from the car to reveal it crossing Boston's huge suspension bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's car pulls up the street and into the parking lot, scraping its side against the corner headlight of one of the rental cars.  JOHN/TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, Jesus. / Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Ted's feet. There are wooden blocks attached to the pedals so that his feet can reach them. He slams on the brakes. ANGLE OUTSIDE THE CAR. John gets out, and looks at the damage.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, man.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it bad?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON THE RENT-A-CAR OFFICE - THOMAS, the branch manager, an intense, middle-aged man, is standing in the doorway. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John! May I speak with you, please?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, go, go, I'll pull outta here. (WAVING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Thomas! How are ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas dryly waves back. Ted pulls forward, scraping the car again. He abruptly pulls out into traffic, and another car swerves a bit to get around him, honking.  OTHER DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asshole!  (CONTINUED) 18 CONTINUED:  TED (OVERLAPPING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, Jersey license!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas sits at his desk facing John.  THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, it's almost ten o'clock.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I'm sorry, it wasn't my fault. THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  JOHN (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I... wasn't really prepared for a follow-up question.  THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, all you have to do is not fuck up, and you get my job when I go to corporate next month. You will be the new branch manager. All you have to do is not fuck up, and all you're doing is fucking up. Not that I don't think you're too fucked up to handle not fucking up my job, but you happen to be the least fucked-up person in the whole office. The next least fucked-up is Alix, and you've been here three fucking years longer than him. But I'm telling you, I will promote the fuck out of him if you fuck up one more time. That is all. Fuck.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I promise, you're not gonna regret promoting the fuck out of me.  THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I like hearing that. Because in a month my life now could be your life: a cushy $38,000-a-year branch manager who's personal friends with Tom Skerritt. It's not a bad life, is it?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N--no.  (CONTINUED) 19 CONTINUED:  THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know I'm friends with Tom Skerritt?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you something I don't show too many people, because I don't want anyone treating me differently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thomas takes out a framed picture of himself with Tom Skerritt.  THOMAS (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me and Tom Skerritt. JOHN (SLIGHTLY OVERDONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wowwww.  THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn right, wow. Now get outta here. I'm gonna dock you for being late, and for the scratch on that car. Try and be a little more responsible tomorrow.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will, sir. Thank you. I won't let you down, Goose.  THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top Gun.  THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Skerritt.  THOMAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John emerges from Thomas' office, and walks out into the front desk area.  (CONTINUED) 20 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see his coworker, Guy (a burly Patrick-Warburton type), handing a car key and a rental envelope to a pleasant-looking couple. He looks tired, disheveled, and a little bruised.  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, here's your key and rental agreement, and a complimentary map of Boston. Thanks for choosing Liberty, drive safely.  HUSBAND/WIFE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you./Thanks so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The couple exits. Guy turns to face John.  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, heard you got busted.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Guy, you look like shit, what happened?  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, man. I got fuckin' wasted last night, and my phone says I texted somebody at 3:15 asking them to beat me up. And then at 4:30 I texted the same person saying thanks.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you don't remember it?  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Same as last time. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It... it just seems gay, doesn't it?  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe, yeah.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you're part of some, like, gay beat-up underworld? Like one of those gay beat-up clubs?  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. I dig chicks. I don't remember any of it, I was so fucked up. I might be gay, I don't know. You mind covering for me for a bit? I'm gonna go lay down in the john.   (CONTINUED) 21 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy starts to leave, when ALIX, a foreign guy with a vague European accent, long dark hair, and a great tan walks up.  ALIX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you buddies. Where's it hanging?  GUY/JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Alix. / Hey, how was the club last night?  ALIX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I didn't get in because the bouncer was doucheface, but I made friends in the line.  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, that's good I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see TANYA, an unbelievably gorgeous salesgirl, enter from the back with a set of keys.  TANYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the following, Tanya puts the keys away, walks over to her station and sits.  ALIX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look so pretty today.  TANYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, thanks Alix, I worked out this morning.  ALIX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can tell, you are less fat than you have been.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys, does anybody know a nice restaurant? Like something where the napkins are cloth?  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori and I have been dating four years tomorrow, and I wanted to take her someplace nice.  TANYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow, congratulations, John.  (CONTINUED) 22 CONTINUED:  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys`ve been goin' out for four years?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  GUY THAT'S IN-- (HIGH-PITCHED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --saaaane, my longest relationship was like six months, and then she farted in her sleep. I'm like, I am outta here, man. Was gone before she woke up.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you're... not very tolerant, huh. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori ever fart in front of you?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Many times.  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Italian?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, just seems like-- never mind, take her to Benihana.  TANYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think after four years, maybe she's probably hoping for something more than dinner?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?   (CONTINUED) 23 CONTINUED:  TANYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if I were her, I'd be expecting a proposal.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, nobody's expecting anybody to propose. Marriage isn't... I mean, isn't love enough? I submit that love is enough.  GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could put the ring in her ass and let her fart it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Ted sit on the couch, in the same exact spots we saw them earlier, bookending the day. John drinks a beer as they watch TV. Ted lights up a bong and inhales. The TV blares the opening titles of the 1980 film "Flash Gordon." As "Flash's Theme" plays:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So bad, but so good.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, a study in contrasts.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I love this part. (SINGING ALONG)

dialogues.speaker: HE'S FOR EVERY ONE OF US
dialogues.text: TED (SINGING ALONG)

dialogues.speaker: STAND FOR EVERY ONE OF US
dialogues.text: JOHN (SINGING ALONG)

dialogues.speaker: FLASH
dialogues.text: TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck yeah, Flash! (then) Hey, before I forget, let's nail down a plan for the Bruins game tomorrow night.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't, I'm taking Lori to dinner.  (CONTINUED) 24 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we've been dating four years tomorrow.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck me. Nice.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme ask you something... you don't think she's gonna be expecting something... big, do you?  TED (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, like anal?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, like... a circular gold thing on the finger.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck that! It's four years! You and I have been together 27 years!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted jumps on John, and starts playfully punching him in the face.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my ring, Johnny? Where's my ring, asshole?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it! Jesus Christ, knock it off! He throws Ted off of him.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, do you think she might be expecting me to make that kinda move?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, John. It's a bad idea. And it's the wrong time. What with the economy and... the credit bubble... the Supreme Court... I mean, look at Haiti.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I didn't think about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON TV - We see Flash Gordon facing Ming the Merciless.  (CONTINUED) 25 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: KLYTUS, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: FLASH, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Flash Gordon. Quarterback. New York Jets.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the American fantasy, right here. A professional NFL player is called upon to save the world.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Brady could do that.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tom Brady could do that. The front door opens and LORI, an attractive girl in her mid to late 20's, enters holding several grocery bags.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, sweetie.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Lori.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gets up and gives Lori a kiss.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh. I think you just got me stoned.  JOHN (RE: GROCERIES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we got there?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turkey burgers.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Are we having homos over for dinner or something?  LORI (WISEASS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just you homos.  TED/JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!!!    (CONTINUED) 26 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's funny, John. You got yourself a regular Toni Collette.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, who's that? Is that good?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a comedienne.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh nice. Is she pretty?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's as pretty as she is funny. How was work? LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your dickhead boss?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex is fine. He only hit on me once today, so that's good.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying this to be mean, but I really hope that fucker gets leukemia.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's harmless, I can handle it.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Johnny, while you're up, grab me a beer, huh?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crossing to fridge) Oh yeah, a coupla' Charles Brew-Kowskis?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, a Brew-stoy-ovski would be nice right about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Lori roll her eyes. She's heard this before.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe a Mike Brew-ga-slow-ski?   (CONTINUED) 27 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps a Ted Kazyn-brewski?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, I think I might also have a Martina Navra-ti-brewski.  JOHN/TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh, that doesn't work!/Come on, don't ruin it, yeah, that doesn't work.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit, what do you mean?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't work, the name has to have a "ski" at the end of it. You just put "brewski" on the end of Martina Navratolova.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we were just doing funny names.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's gotta have a "ski" at the end. Otherwise where's the challenge? If there's no "ski" at the end of the root word, then we would just be idiots saying nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining, with an occasional roll of thunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori lies in bed holding an iPad, reading a gossip news site, with the TV on. John comes out of the bathroom, and cozies up next to her.  LORI (OFF IPAD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, look, they found those missing hikers.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They did? What happened?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says they got separated and one of them had his foot trapped under a rock for five days.  (CONTINUED) 28 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if your leg got trapped under a rock, I'd chew it off to get you free.  LORI (SWEETLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sure would. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that cannibalism?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think it's only cannibalism if you swallow. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, no, I don't swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? That's not what I heard about you.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not true, I'm a fuckin' classy broad.  LORI (LAUGHS AGAIN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, speaking of classy, Ciao Bella's a really expensive restaurant. If you want, we can go somewhere else tomorrow night. I don't care, as long as we're together.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kiddin' me? Four years we been going out, I'm takin' you to the best place in town. I been crappin' out room for it for two days, I know exactly what I'm gonna order.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in to kiss him) You're disgusting.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you get to pick any bottle of wine.   (CONTINUED) 29 CONTINUED:  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any bottle of 2012 wine.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, are the new wines in?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are in and they. Are. Fresh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans over and kisses him again. He kisses her back.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to kiss, becoming more and more intimate. She starts to pull his T-shirt off, when there is a thunder clap from outside.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, come on!  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head) I don't understand it, 35 years old, and you're still scared of a little thunder.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not. We hear another thunderclap. Ted runs into the room with no warning and leaps into bed, right between Lori and John.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder buddies for life, right Johnny? C'mon, let's sing the thunder song!  JOHN/TED (SINGING)

dialogues.speaker: JUST GOD'S FARTS.
dialogues.text: TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boomp. (CONTINUED) 30 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori rolls over and goes to sleep with a groan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori enters the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori gets off the elevator, where we see several signs that read "PLYMOUTH PUBLIC RELATIONS." Lori goes to her desk, looking exhausted. Lori's office friends, GINA, MICHELLE, and TRACY approach.  GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow...Baby, I'm not saying this to be nasty, but you look really tired.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm okay... except I didn't have time for breakfast, the garage was full, I spilled coffee on my leg, and I have a boyfriend who can't sleep through a storm without his teddy bear.  GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand why you keep putting up with him.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean, the guy's thirty-five years old and he's working for a rental car service.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not that, I don't care about that. I'd love him even if he was a janitor. I mean, he's got a huge heart, we laugh together all the time, and it's just a bonus that he's like the hottest guy in Boston.  GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah but the hottest guy in Boston is like being the classiest Kardashian.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish he could get his life together, you know? Our life. And he can't, and I swear to god, it's all because of that bear.    (CONTINUED) 31 CONTINUED:  MICHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should give him an ultimatum: it's you or the bear.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that, he'd be devastated. And I mean... what if he chose Ted?  MICHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh come on, you don't really think that.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really, but what if?  MICHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then... things happen for a reason. TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No they don't. That's just something girls say when something bad happens to them that they don't understand.  GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's boss REX (asshole handsome, mid-30's, expensive suit) walks into the office, and approaches the gathering of female employees.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well hello there. Sorry if I'm interrupting any private girl talk about Channing Tatum's index finger but Lori I need to see you in my office.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually Rex, I have a lot of work I need to get to--  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is work, I swear.  LORI (SIGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori follows Rex and gives the girls a "help!" look.  MICHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's such an asshole.   (CONTINUED) 32 CONTINUED:  GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of control. Such a sleaze.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are so pathetic. You're shitting on Rex, and you both had sex with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short beat.  GINA/MICHELLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like once./I was drunk.  GINA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so did you.  TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I didn't want one of you whores getting promoted before me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori sits across from Rex, who sits at a large desk.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... what do you need to talk to me about, Rex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex takes a framed picture out of a drawer, and shows it to her.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that? That's me on the diving team in high school. We dove the shit outta that pool that year. If you look close, you can see the outline of my root.  LORI (ANNOYED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promised this was about work.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori, what is wrong with you? Why don't you like me? I'm rich, I'm good-looking, my dad owns the company--  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a boyfriend, Rex. I think you know this.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, the guy with the teddy bear, that's a cute relationship, but I'm talking about being with a real man, Lori. (MORE) (CONTINUED) 33 CONTINUED: REX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone who wears a blazer on an airplane.  LORI (STANDING UP)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very busy.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then, how do you have all that time to be in my head?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Rex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori exits Rex's office. Rex casually gets up, strolls over to her chair, nonchalantly brushes his hand on the cushion where she was sitting, and nonchalantly smells his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori sit across from each other at a romantically set table. They've just finished their meal. John has the remains of a lobster shell on his plate.  LORI (SATISFIED SIGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITRESS approaches. WAITRESS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like me to wrap up your leftovers?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I'm fine, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John holds up the front portion of the lobster shell, which has the face and eyes on it.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, could you wrap just this up for me? I wanna scare the shit outta somebody.  WAITRESS (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. (CONTINUED) 34 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress walks away.  LORI (MILDLY AMUSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, five years old?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I read at a six year-old level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another WAITER approaches with a bottle of champagne, two glasses, and some chocolate-covered strawberries.  WAITER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor. Senora, here is your dessert and champagne.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, Cristal.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a special night. We've been dating for four years. (TAKING BOTTLE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And hey, all those rich black people can't be wrong, right?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't seem like four years, does it?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (affectionately taking her HAND)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it doesn't.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had no business being out on that dance floor, but I'm glad you were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Lori out on the dance floor, amidst a sea of dancing clubgoers. Nearby, we see John dancing with a girl, and doing it very badly. He's putting too much into it, obviously trying to impress her. The girl is gamely tolerating it, but is clearly not digging the moves. John thrusts his butt back in one move, accidentally bumping a girl behind him with enough force to send her sprawling on the floor. As the crowd reacts to this, we see that it is Lori. She starts to get up, when John turns and rushes to help her to her feet.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, are you okay? Oh god, I'm so sorry! (CONTINUED) 35 CONTINUED:  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little stunned) Yeah, I'm... I'm fine.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, I'm so so sorry! I didn't see you! It was an accident!  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, yeah, I... I would hope it was an accident.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hurt your head?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, yes. My head hurts a lot. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man. Here, let me get you some ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down. He reaches into a nearby glass, pulls out a handful of ice, and wraps it in a napkin. He puts it against her head. She inhales sharply for a moment.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Does it hurt?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, noticing him for the FIRST TIME)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N... No. No it's okay.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, noticing too) I'm... I'm John. LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Lori.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile at each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here's a question that'll show how much you actually care about me. You remember we stayed and talked until the place closed, and then we went for late night eggs and waffles, and we stayed there til 5 a.m. watching a movie on the little TV in the diner. Name the movie.   (CONTINUED) 36 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Octopussy.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold star.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But does that show that I care about you, or I care about Roger Moore?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna give you the benefit of the doubt.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. And by the way, my dancing was not that bad. LORI (LAUGHING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dancing was bad.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had some cool moves.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do people with Parkinson's.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how I remember it.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, how do you remember it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see John leaning against the bar, wearing a white Navy officer's uniform, a la Ted Stryker in "Airplane!" as "Stayin' Alive" blasts from the jukebox. ANGLE ON LORI, who is up on the dance floor, done up like Julie Hagerty. John takes his hat off, and tosses it O.S. coolly. He struts up to the dance floor, locks eyes with Lori. They circle one another for a beat. John suavely takes off his jacket, twirls it in the air a few times, and tosses it O.S. He then strikes a "finger up" disco pose, with a bullet SFX. He and Lori begin disco dancing simultaneously. He jumps up, locking his legs around Lori, who spins him around in circles, as we cut back to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you say, baby. (CONTINUED) 37 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, here's to four more years, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink glasses, and take a sip.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I know we said no gifts, but--  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we didn't.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --But, I got you something anyway, in clear violation of the "no gift" rule.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was no such rule. John reaches into his jacket pocket and pulls out a small box. Lori looks excited.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori, I've wanted to give this to you for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John slides the box over to Lori. She picks it up.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori unwraps the box and opens it. Inside is a pair of nice, but not-super-expensive-looking earrings.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those are the ones you liked, right? From that kiosk at the mall? LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens up the card, which we see as John describes it. It says, "Happy 4 year anniversary! Love you."  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, I even wrote the words with different colored markers so you wouldn't get bored while you were reading it.  LORI (UNENTHUSED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Thanks. Well, um, here. This is for you. (CONTINUED) 38 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori hands John a small box. He opens it up, revealing a very nice watch.  JOHN (OPENS BOX)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow, a Hamilton!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts it on his wrist.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember you liked it when you saw Tom Brady wearing one in GQ.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean his was analog, but this is so awesome, I love it! She reacts a bit to this.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, Lori... (INDICATING BOX)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday, there's gonna be a ring in there. But I wanna wait `til I can get you something really special, y'know? I just don't have the money right now.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I don't need the Hope diamond, all I want is--  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but it's important to me that you have the engagement ring you deserve. And what with the credit bubble... the Supreme Court... I mean, look at Haiti. LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm only saying this because I love you, but that's not realistic. You're never gonna have any kind of a career if you're always partying and wasting time with Ted.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, here we go--  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, please get him to find his own place, so we can get on with our lives.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, can we talk about this another time, and just enjoy our anniversary dinner? (CONTINUED) 39 CONTINUED:  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fine. Let's talk about it ten years from now.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolling his eyes with a SIGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori, we can't talk about this every time we go out. Look, he's been my best friend since I was eight. And I was not a popular child. You have to understand, I had no friends before he came along. He's the only reason I ever gained any fucking confidence. I coulda wound up like that Asian kid at Virginia Tech, but I didn't. `Cause of him. So, y'know, I'm not that psyched to just, like, kick him out.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's good to know that a talking teddy bear is the only thing that kept you from gunning down your classmates, but John, you're not eight. You're thirty-five. And unless you're too blind to notice, he's not your only friend anymore. You have me. And I love you.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too. You know that.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I've put the best physical years of my life into this. I mean, I'm cute now, but in a few years my body's gonna fall off a fucking cliff. Things'll be hanging and stretching in ways that might scare a man. I need to feel secure in the fact that you won't leave me when that happens.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not only will I not leave you, it's gonna be even better. `Cause I can have sex with you, and press your arm fat against a comic book so I can see it backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs. So does he.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, my boobs and vagina will all be in the same place, so that's a lot less movin' around for you.   (CONTINUED) 40 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do it all with one hand.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, and you can do whatever you want with the other hand.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can write a novel. Maybe a bestseller.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can achieve critical acclaim and become rich just by screwing each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh hard.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I hope these jokes have distracted you from the actual problems in our relationship.  LORI (SIGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't put the real conversation off forever, John.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno, I got a lotta fuckin' jokes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their car pulls up. They start to get out.  JOHN (NOTICING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah shit, hang on, my phone fell under the seat somewhere. Can you call it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori punches his number on her cellphone. After a beat, we hear The Imperial March from "The Empire Strikes Back."  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my ringtone?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs, embarrassed) Oh, yeah...  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? It sounds negative.   (CONTINUED) 41 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's from The Notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches under the seat, fishing for the phone, as she goes inside.  JOHN (CONT'D) (STRAINING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna take some doin'.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, well I'll see you upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues digging for the phone, as she walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori walks toward the apartment, but stops as she hears loud music coming from inside. She approaches the door cautiously and opens it, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori enters a haze of pot smoke, and a very much trashed apartment (empty bottles, wrappers, etc.). Ted sits on the sofa with a small group of trashy-looking women. They're watching "Romancing the Stone," which plays very loudly on the TV.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is all this?!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori! Hey, you're home early! The ladies and I were just watching "Romancing the Stone." Got it on Blu- Ray. Came in a two-pack with "Jewel of the Nile," but I don't know that we'll end up watchin' that one.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is a wreck! Who are these girls?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, where are my manners? Lori, this is Angelique, Heavenly, Cherene, and Sauvignon Blanc. I love you girls. Y'know, somewhere out there are four terrible fathers I wish I could thank for this great night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls ad-lib "Hello," "Nice to meet you," etc. (CONTINUED) 42 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori glances around the room, then SCREAMS as she sees something in the corner.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?!!!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's what?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is... a shit in the corner! On the floor! There's a shit!  TED (LOOKING OVER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man, that's what Dierdre was doin' over there in the corner for so long. Remember, she was crouched over there and I thought she was just makin' a call or SOMETHIN'--  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a shit!! On my floor!!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's passed out in the bathroom now, she seemed like she was hopped up on somethin'. I mean, mystery solved, I GUESS--  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck!!!!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori, if I can-- now this is just speculation, but... is it possible that this is not so much about the stool in the corner, and more about maybe tonight's dinner not measuring up to your expectations?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!!! The fuck!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori is speechless with rage. At that moment, we see the lobster head poke in aggressively from behind the door.

dialogues.speaker: RAAARRRR
dialogues.text: TED (POINTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahaaaaa!   (CONTINUED) 43 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN, (V.O., AS LOBSTER)
dialogues.text: Who lives here? I'm comin' to get whoever lives here! You owe me lobster money!  TED (TO GIRL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hahaaa! That's my friend John. Not the lobster, the guy runnin' it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that moment, John enters, holding his cell phone.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found my phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, seeing everyone there. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's goin' on? (then, noticing) Is that a shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and John walk slowly down the ramp circling the massive see-through tank, occasionally stopping to observe some of the more bizarre varieties of fish. John is oddly restrained. Something is on his mind. As they stroll, we see a nearby man keeping an eye on them. He seems much more interested in them than in the fish. This, we will find out later, is DONNY... TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, there are some fucked up fish out there.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, look at that one. Mister tough guy fish. (tough guy voice:) "Hey! Whatsa big idea? Cold fusion? Well that is a big idea, I beg pardon!" Look at that guy. WASP-y white guy fish. (tight-ass white guy voice:) "I don't care for some of Conan O'Brien's humor. I don't like Irish humor. And this food is too flavorful. I don't care for flavor in my food." (MORE) (CONTINUED) 44 CONTINUED: TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (switching to goofy voice as a bottle-nosed fish swims BY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oh hey, sorry I'm late, guys. Hey, where's everybody goin'? Any of you guys got a tissue? I'm allergic to water."  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted... you gotta move out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted turns and stares at John for a beat.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wh... what?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... it's gotta happen. Ted sits down on a bench, a little stunned and dazed.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...what did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks heartbroken at this response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and John sit side-by-side on a bench next to the penguin habitat.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, my relationship is at a very delicate stage, and, y'know, Lori and I may just need a little space right now. Plus a hooker took a shit in our apartment.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look, that was a tough night for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori is staring at the O.S. poop in the corner. She is trying to pick it up with a shoebox. In the background, we can see an almost panicky, grossed-out John peering out from behind the bathroom door.  LORI (BEYOND DISGUSTED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, god!!   (CONTINUED) 45 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaa, what?!  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so gross!!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, I don't wanna hear about it! Did you get it?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Oh my god!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me when you get it!  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAA, I got some on my thumb!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAA! You can never cook with that hand again! I'm serious, learn to cook other- handed!  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get the next one, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's makin' you do it, isn't she? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving up the bullshit) Yes. But, that doesn't mean we can't hang out. We'll hang out all the time!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about... thunder buddies for life, Johnny?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Fuck. I just don't know what to do here. I know it sucks, but otherwise I'm gonna lose her. And I do love her, Ted.  TED (SIGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you do, Johnny.  (CONTINUED) 46 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll help you get on your feet out there, I promise.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we'll hang out a lot, right?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, all the time.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (arms wide for a hug) Bring it over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hugs Ted. Ted hugs him back. We hear a squeak, and a high-pitched recorded voice saying "I wuv you." John and Ted pull away from each other uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That was the-- the thing-- The old-- Yeah-- no, I know- that doesn't mean-- I'm not - gay.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get you a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Ted head toward the store. Ted is dressed in a coat and tie, and looks very uncomfortable.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look stupid.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't. You look dapper.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look like Snuggles' accountant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pause as John straightens Ted's tie.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know it sucks, but you gotta make some money so you can pay for an apartment.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna work at a grocery store.   (CONTINUED) 47 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you have no skills.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, I can totally be a lawyer.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I said, you would need a law degree from a law school.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a special case. I'm a fucking talking bear. They might make an exception `cause they're all like, "Aaa! This bear can talk and do stuff! Let's give him a job and maybe he'll give us a few laughs," but then they're surprised at what a stellar performance I'm turnin' in. And then they practically have to give me the Anderson case.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you get the job, and we'll celebrate after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John discreetly pulls out a baggie of weed.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I don't get the job will we still smoke that pot?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably, yes.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting John on the leg) Yeah. Okay, good speech, coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted sits opposite FRANK, the grocery store manager. We see his name and title on a desk nameplate. Frank sits at the desk, staring at Ted.  FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. You think you got what it takes?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.  FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat, then) No one's ever talked to me like that before. You're hired. (CONTINUED) 48 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Over music:) John and Ted walk across the Common, passing various park-goers. The occasional person notices and points with a "Hey, isn't that..." sort of look. They passes three cute girls who flag Ted down. Two pose with him as the third takes their picture with her cellphone. Ted poses for the photo with one hand on the girl's breast. She laughs hard. Ted waves goodbye, and he and John make their way over to a park bench. They sit. John takes out the weed, looks around for a beat, then starts to discreetly roll a joint. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm a former celebrity with a minimum wage job. This must be what the cast of Different Strokes feels like.

dialogues.speaker: O.S. VOICE
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Ted react, startled. John stuffs the weed in his pocket, accidentally dropping the buds in the rolling papers on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON a creepy-looking man glancing at them repeatedly. This is Donny, the fat kid we saw in the prologue. He has grown up into a thinner but no less creepy man.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to bother you, but my son and I couldn't help but admire your teddy bear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ADJUST TO REVEAL his son, who looks exactly like fat young Donny from earlier.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little uncomfortable) Oh. Um, thank you.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Donny. And this is my boy, Robert. I have to tell you, I've been fascinated by your story ever since I was a boy. I remember seeing you on the Carson show. You were just wonderful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRIEF ANGLE ON the ground, where a pigeon is pecking at the dropped weed.  (CONTINUED) 49 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was ah... that was a good time.  DONNY (TO JOHN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder, is there any chance I could purchase the bear from you? For my son?  JOHN/TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? / Excuse me?  ROBERT (CALM)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what my favorite thing about you is? After four years, you can still surprise me. To step up and change such a big part of your life just to make your girlfriend happier... I dunno, I bet you most guys couldn't do it.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you were right! Look, the reason I love you so much is the same reason I guess I take you for granted sometimes. It's `cause you're... inevitable.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (huh?) Inevitable. Well, that's... romantic? I think?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

She giggles and blows him a kiss back. He pantomimes hard, thrusting, standing-up sex. Her eyes widen for a beat, as she stares, then smiles. He grabs an Oh Henry bar, and pantomimes fellatio. The girl laughs hysterically. CLOSE ANGLE on Ted, as white liquid sprays all over his face from one side, then from the other. WIDEN to reveal he's squirting two bottles of pump hand soap on either side of him. The girl laughs and shakes her head "no."  TED (CONT'D) (TO HIMSELF)
