dialogues.text: Lori can't help but let a small laugh escape. She softens a bit...  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John... this really is your last chance. I can't do this anymore.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't have to. Trust me. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her.  LORI (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, sweetie, I love you so much! You won't be sorry, I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him, then:  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you really just fart?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I pushed it that way with my hand.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Wonder where it'll hit first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDER ANGLE on the restaurant. For a moment, nothing happens.  (CONTINUED) 66 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, a guy at a table on the right (sitting with a couple other men and women) screams into his napkin, followed by his dining companions.

dialogues.speaker: GUY AT TABLE
dialogues.text: (FURIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this to us?!

dialogues.speaker: GUY
dialogues.text: (FURIOUS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God dammit! I'm here on business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted's boss, Frank, emerges from the back, writing on a clipboard. He looks up, and his expression turns to confused anger as he sees an unusually long line at Ellen's register.  FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over to the line. A GUY IN LINE turns and notices him.

dialogues.speaker: GUY IN LINE
dialogues.text: Hey, dude, you think you could open more than one register? There's like a thousand people here!  FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's supposed to be three registers open, for god's sake!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around, aggravated, for a moment, then storms off toward the back. He looks around the butcher's counter and produce area, then walk into the back storeroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank opens the door, and reacts with shock. REVERSE ANGLE where we see Ted on top of Tami Lynn, who is almost naked. He is doing a very close approximation of banging her wildly. We see his furry bear butt pumping away, with its little tail on the end. Frank screams in shock and horror. 67

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits at his desk, addressing Ted.  FRANK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had sexual intercourse with a coworker in a storeroom filled with produce that we sell to the public.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  FRANK (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That took guts. We need guts. I'm promoting you. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the "CLOSED" sign on the door. Ted exits, finishing off a bottle of beer. He walks around to the dumpster alley, and lines up for a Kareem-style sky hook shot into a trash can. He takes the shot:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kareem!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bottle smashes off the side of the can, and shatters.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You suck, Kareem. We hear a soft footstep somewhere O.S. Ted turns and looks around. There appears to be no one in the darkness.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. He looks around for a beat, and finds nothing. He turns... and finds himself facing Donny, who stands eerily lit by a single outdoor wall bulb.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Ted.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gah! Uh... hi there.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all alone out here? (CONTINUED) 68 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... no. No I'm not. I'm... you know, you're never alone when you're with Christ.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Robert and I could give you a very, very good home.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... I'm pretty happy where I am. I just got a shitty new apartment--  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can offer you six thousand dollars in railroad bonds. They were left to me by my father. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, gosh, you know, since I just returned from active duty in the Civil War, that sounds really appealing. Oh wait, no, that was a hundred and fifty years ago, and I don't give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tami-Lynn approaches.  TAMI-LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teddy, come on-- we're gonna have pop tarts and cigarettes with my mom before she goes to work.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm comin', sweetheart. (TO DONNY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, my dance card is quite full, so I'm gonna have to decline.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really wish you wouldn't...  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry. But, ah... you know, I'd like to thank you for creepin' up my night, and... Jesus be with you. In Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted hurries off. ANGLE ON DONNY, who looks eerily determined. 69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori walk up to the fabulously expansive house in Cambridge. It's a very impressive estate with no expense spared.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at him warmly) I'm glad you're here.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. Is it cool if I kick your boss' ass? That won't affect your workplace chemistry, will it?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play nice. Please. Rex throws open the door.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There she is! I was worried you weren't coming! (TO JOHN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi kiddo, how ya doin'? Where's your bunny rabbit?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a bear.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ushering them in) Got it. "Hey, this house is fucking huge!" I know guys, try not to get lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is a very costly-looking event: uniformed servers walking around with trays of cocktails and hors d'ouvres, tables laden with lavish-looking food displays and floral arrangements, a 20-piece big band, and hundreds of guests. A large banner reads "Happy 20th Anniversary, Plymouth Public Relations."  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, here come the ladies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gina, Michelle, and Tracy approach. Everyone adlibs their hellos to John and Lori. A waiter walks by with a tray of champagne. Lori and the girls each take a glass.     (CONTINUED) 70 CONTINUED:  REX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say listen, why don't John and I give you gals a chance to talk tampax while we go grab a drink at the bar, huh?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex and John are walking up the stairs to the second floor of his house. Rex points out various items bought at auction. John is visibly unenthused. He does not like this guy, and definitely does not trust him.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and that's a Wade Boggs autographed bat. Just barely outbid Phil Donahue for that at auction.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, cool.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, cool. And those boxing gloves were worn by Joe Louis in his first fight. (passing an abstract PAINTING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is art. Do you get it? (passing wall mounted pair of GLASSES) )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These were John Lennon's glasses. Worth about two million dollars. (passing photo on wall) ) That's me and Tom Skerritt. Oh, and check this out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex indicates a small, bronze-colored item on a stand.  REX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See that? Know what that is?  JOHN (TOUCHING IT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Lance Armstrong's nut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John quickly pulls his hand away.  REX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something, isn't it? Had it freeze-dried and bronzed. (MORE) (CONTINUED) 71 CONTINUED: REX (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every now and then, when I feel like my life's gettin' me down and things are tough, I just come in here and look at it, and it reminds me that things aren't so bad. That some people have it worse than me. I mean, he's only got one ball, and I have three. One of them, of course, being his.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's inspiring. You've led a rich life.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've fucked the shit outta life. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So talk to me, Goose. How are things with you and Lori?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things are great, actually.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good, that's good.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know... Lori would hate me for saying this, but... she's told me how you are at the office, and... as one gentleman to another, I just wanna say I really hope you fucking get Lou Gehrig's disease.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, okay, look, I think I oughtta just clear the air here a little. I... just want you to know that... I mean, yeah, I'm kind of a "fun-time boss" and whatnot, but... look man, I do that with everybody at the office! I'm just a kook! I have no designs on your girlfriend. We work together, and that's it. I think you're a great guy and she's very lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is a bit surprised, not unpleasantly so, to hear this.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... that's good to hear.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's how it is, so...there we go.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. (CONTINUED) 72 CONTINUED:  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand there for a beat, looking at Lance Armstrong's nut. John's phone rings the "Knight Rider" theme. John answers it.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT PERIODICALLY BETWEEN JOHN AND TED, who stands in the foreground with one finger in his ear. In the background, we see a party in full swing.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Johnny! You gotta get over here, man! JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: TED, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm havin' a little impromptu thing with some people, and John... Sam Jones is here.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: TED, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sam Jones. Flash fucking Gordon. Is here.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember I said, my buddy's cousin is friends with Sam Jones? My buddy's in town with his cousin and who's with `em? Sam Jones!!

dialogues.speaker: TED, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sam Jones is here, and John... (softly, into phone) ...his hair is parted down the middle.  JOHN (EQUALLY SOFTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like in the movie. (CONTINUED) 73 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get over here.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! I can't... I'm with Lori. I'm already on probation here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks down at the main area of the party, and sees Lori happily chatting with her co-workers.  JOHN (CONT'D) (AGONIZED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John. There are moments in a man's life: Nathan Hale, "I regret that I have but one life to give for my country." Alan Hale, "Yes, I accept the role of the Skipper on `Gilligan's Island.'"

dialogues.speaker: TED, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: John, this is your Alan Hale moment. For god's sake, come share this with me.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, then:) I'm coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John hangs up. JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex. I gotta go. I'll be back in thirty minutes tops, but Lori cannot find out. She absolutely cannot know I was gone. If you can cover for me... we're cool on all that other stuff.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got your back, my friend. Been there. She'll never know.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one man to another. I don't really know you, but I'm trusting you. As a man. This is serious. Can I trust you?   (CONTINUED) 74 CONTINUED:  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. One man to another. I got you on this.  JOHN (RELAXING SOMEWHAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John races O.S.... and Rex raises his scotch glass to his mouth.  REX (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna make traditional to your girlfriend. And then fuck her in the ass. All right. We have a game plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "Football Fight" music from "Flash Gordon" starts playing, as John bolts O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sprints out of the house and runs down the walkway. He leaps over a hedge toward the parking area. He slides across the hood of Lori's car, gets in, quickly starts the car, and backs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO various shots of John racing through the city on his way to Ted's. Finally, he pulls up to Ted's apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John throws open the door. The place is as lively as it can be. The party is packed with people, including Alix and Tanya, John's co-workers from Liberty. There are also a large number of booze-swilling guys and hot chicks. Ted runs up, wearing a blazer.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny! Thank Christ you made it!  JOHN (QUICKLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got ten minutes, where's Flash Gordon?   (CONTINUED) 75 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, get ready, man. (to someone O.S.) Hey, Sam! This is the guy I was tellin' you about!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns to look in the direction Ted is indicating. The shot slows down into slo-mo as John's eyes widen, and he sees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPPOSITE ANGLE - Across the room, SAM J. JONES turns in slo-mo to face John. He is inexplicably still sporting the same hairstyle he had in the "Flash Gordon" movie. We hear the theme from "Flash Gordon." We INTERCUT back and forth from him to John:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JOHN - He stands frozen in awe. ON SAM - He smiles as he begins to walk toward the camera, in John's POV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JOHN - He continues to stare in frozen awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SAM - Still slowly walking toward camera in John's POV, but he is now dressed in the Flash Gordon costume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON JOHN - He continues to stare in frozen awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam J. Jones flies on the flying Jetski from the movie. John stands behind him on the back, with his arms around Sam's chest, as if on the back seat of a motorcycle. John has a huge, elated smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON John - He still stares in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SAM - He smiles and offers an outstretched hand for a handshake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK TO NORMAL SPEED - Sam walks up to John with Ted by his side.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, this is Sam Jones. Sam, this is my best friend in the whole world, John.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there. Good to meet you.   (CONTINUED) 76 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in absolute fucking awe) I... thank you for saving every one of us.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. Hey, let's do some shots, huh?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With you? Yes. Oh my god, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam passes out shots of Southern Comfort.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his glass) Death to Ming! John and Ted look at each other, squealing with delight. Everyone then does their shots.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys seem pretty cool. (SIGNIFICANTLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like to party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Ted don't answer for a beat. They look at each other nervously. It's clear neither one has any experience with this sort of thing.  SAM (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, come on dudes. Don't tell me you've never done it before.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little scared) Not... recently, no.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fellas better come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, Ted, and Sam emerge from the bathroom. John's eyes are wide and enthusiastic. Ted has a little bit of powder on his nose, and his ears are flattened back. And Sam is just playing it cool.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's party like the `80's huh?  (CONTINUED) 77 CONTINUED:  TED (REVERENTIAL)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show us how, Flash.  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy. We just gotta bang a lotta girls named Stephanie.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit. (looking around intensely) All these people need to be talked to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Ted sit staring at each other intensely across the table.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Johnny, if we're ever gonna get serious about openin' a restaurant we gotta start plannin' it now.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Italian.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Italian, yes.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the special on Tuesdays?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggplant parm. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chopped salad half price.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's a non-restricted place.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah--wait, whaddaya mean?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody can come.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mormons are welcome.   (CONTINUED) 78 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yeah--why wouldn't they be?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly, that's what I'm saying.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why even bring that up--  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't bring it up. You just let `em in.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but why mention it?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one will.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are we talking about it?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talkin' about it, I'm just sayin' let `em in.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, let `em in.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Catholics, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted stands opposite a group of party guests who sit on the couch. He holds a knife.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No see, I can do this.  GUY #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. (CONTINUED) 79 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My teddy bear biology gives me superhuman reflexes.  GUY #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let him try it, man.  GUY #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy #1 puts his hand down on the coffee table and Ted starts doing the knife trick from "Aliens". He gets it right for a few seconds, then stabs the guy right through the hand. The guy screams in pain.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you never shoulda trusted me, I'm on drugs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stands with a pair of fake bear ears on his head, doing an impression of Ted as a small group of partygoers (Ted included) watches, laughing hysterically.  JOHN (AS TED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Johnny, I just had a great idea-- let's go get drunk and puke on cars from the overpass!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, that was a fun day.  JOHN (AS TED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny, you gotta get over here man, I just tried this DMT all the kids are talkin' about, and I'm in trouble! I think I got sucked inside my chair!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not sound that much like Peter Griffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted sits on the couch drawing a pair of Garfield eyes on a topless girl. Below the eyes he has drawn the muzzle and the mouth, and above them the ears.    (CONTINUED) 80 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? There. Proof. Garfield's eyes look like a pair of tits.  TAMI-LYNN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you were right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted stands by the TV, singing a karaoke version of "I Only Want to be with You" by Hootie and the Blowfish.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Johnny, c'mon up here and do this with me! JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't sing in front of people!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, John and Ted stand by the wall.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See there's this one part of the wall that's really soft, you could punch through it wicked easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam punches the wall a couple times, and his fist goes right through.  (CONTINUED) 81 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: SAM/TED/JOHN
dialogues.text: Holy shit! / Ha! / Wow! / Etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Immediately we see half an Asian face dart into frame through the hole. He screams in Cantonese, then,  ASIAN MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you problem!! You break my wall! You break my wall I break you wall!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighbor sticks a knife through the hole. John, Ted, and Sam scream. Sam and John jump around and scream as they frantically try to get the knife.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAA! AAA!! Break his arm, Flash! Cut his arm off!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam grabs the arm, and it darts back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an angry pounding on the door. One of the party guests opens it, and the Asian guy runs in, screaming in Cantonese. He holds a wooden spoon in one hand, and a live duck in the other. John, Sam, and Ted run back out into the living room. The Asian guy runs toward them, screaming first in Cantonese, then:  ASIAN MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You break my wall! This my home long time! You break my wall! You bastard men! JOHN/TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, we're sorry! We're sorry!  ASIAN MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard men! I try to make duck dinner, now plaster everywhere!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill out okay? We'll pay for it! Let's talk this out okay? What's your name? I'm John!  ASIAN MAN (CAUTIOUSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name Wan Ming.  FLASH (NARROWING EYES)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ming! (CONTINUED) 82 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAM'S POV - We see the Asian man dressed as Ming the Merciless.  ASIAN MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pay many dollar for wall! This bullshit! This all bullshit!  SAM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few concert personnel rush out to check the guy. STAGEHAND

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone call an ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd is now shouting angrily at John. But he is only focused n one spot in the crowd. He sees that Lori and Rex are gone. Almost oblivious to the rest of the frenzy, he sighs, heartbroken. A couple of concert security personnel haul him offstage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rex escorts Lori to his car.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was insane. Did you see the way that guy's body hit the ground? It was like a rag doll! LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'd rather just not talk about it.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go get a drink after this? I feel like I could use one after seeing a guy almost die.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, I think I'd rather you just take me home.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One drink, come on.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, not really feeling up to it.   (CONTINUED) 99 CONTINUED:  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, I get it. I don't blame you. When you think about it, it was actually really unfair of him to embarrass you like that.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just to be clear, I am not embarrassed. Listen, John and I may have our problems but at least he tried. You know what? I don't feel like talking to you about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks away.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going? LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking a cab. I'm going home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she disappears out of earshot, Rex closes his eyes and releases a fart.  REX

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXT./ ESTAB. JOHN & LORI'S APARTMENT BUILDING - DAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori gets out of the shower, and begins towelling off, still reeling with disgust from her encounter with Rex. After a few moments, there's a knock at the door. Lori sighs with annoyance, and walks to the door, still in her towel. She looks through the peephole, but there's no one there. She opens the door cautiously, and looks out into the hall. There's no one there.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Down here, I swear to god I'm not lookin' up your towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down with a start, and sees Ted standing there. He's blocking his view with one hand.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not lookin' up your towel. Not lookin' at your funny business.     (CONTINUED) 100 CONTINUED:  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling towel closer to her) Ted? What're you doing here? What do you want?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, if you're here to fight John's battle for hi--  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori, do me a favor and let me talk first, and then you can say whatever you want. There's a beat. She reluctantly considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori, now in a robe, sits down on the couch, facing Ted.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, John loves you very much. More than anything in the world. And he's fallin' to fuckin' pieces without you. He knows he screwed up big time, but you gotta believe me that is wasn't all his fault. If you'll just give him one more chance to be with you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rolls her eyes.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me! If you'll just give him one more chance... I promise I will leave and never come back. He'll be all yours. Just give him one more chance.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted... that's a very nice offer, but I don't want you to do that. This is about John and me and our problems. And I don't think it can be fixed.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of me! Look, you want him to be a man. And I'm the one who's keepin' that from happening. As long as he's got his teddy bear, he's still a boy. And I care about him as much as you do. But I'm willing to give up the boy so you can have the man. (CONTINUED) 101 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see Lori starting to soften a bit.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm givin' this the best shot I got here, Lori. I'm beggin' you. I'm no good at this emotional crap, but I gotta help my best friend. Please. Just talk to him.  LORI (SIGH)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to him.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. He's waitin' for me down at Charley's. So... maybe you could, y'know... go down instead of me? LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... now?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. You'll regret it for the rest of your life if you don't.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori emerges from the bedroom, dressed, and heads for the door. Ted is on the couch watching TV.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flipping on TV) Hey, you mind if I stay and watch the Sox?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door shuts and she's gone. Ted gets up and walks into the kitchen. He opens the fridge.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, what a chick fridge. Yoplait, a cantaloupe, and a Brita water filter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens up a crisper drawer, and looks at a six-pack of beer bottles.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelob Ultra Tuscan Orange Grapefruit. My god, America is imploding.   (CONTINUED) 102 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shakes his head as he opens the beer, and walks into the other room. He settles down in a recliner, and watches the game. After a moment, there's a knock at the door. Ted sighs with annoyance, and gets up.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget your keys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks to the door, and opens it up.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, your beer suck--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He freezes, and looks up. We reveal Donny, the creepy man from earlier, with his son Robert.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Ted.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny throws a sack over Ted, trapping him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's car pulls up, and she gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori enters, and looks around. She spots John, who looks up from a menu. He is surprised to see her. She sighs and walks over to him. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori! What-- what are you doing here?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can thank Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. John smiles slightly.  LORI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good. I've, uh... made myself a nice little home at the Midtown Hotel up the street. I'd show you around, but it's kinda classy. They require an undershirt and at least one visible cold sore for all customers.  (CONTINUED) 103 CONTINUED:  LORI (LAUGHS HUMORLESSLY)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Shall I sit?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does. There's a beat. A busboy brings them each a water.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, work's good? Everything good there?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Work's fine.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Rex?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no Rex.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Good. (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I guess we can't make small talk all day, so I'll say what I wanna say. I could sit here and tell you I'm sorry, it was a huge misunderstanding, and I'm ready to change. But I don't think you wanna hear any of that crap. I'm not gonna try and get you to take me back. Why would you? I've been a really shitty boyfriend for the last four years. I don't deserve you. I didn't take our relationship seriously, even though I love you more than life itself. All I want is... just to end on good terms. Because I owe that to you. I want you to be happy... and for us to be friends.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little taken aback) Wow. Thank you. I appreciate that.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. That's pretty much it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes out some money, and puts it on the table, paying the check. He smiles at her and walks out. She sits there for a beat. 104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny's car pulls up. The house is a low-class, creepily shabby-looking Boston home (think Buffalo Bill in "Silence of the Lambs"). It's close to one end of the base of a bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny carries the sack inside, and unceremoniously dumps Ted onto the floor. Ted looks around. It's just as shitty on the inside as on the outside. On the walls, there are a disturbing number of newspaper clippings, photo spreads, etc. Most are from press from Ted's media heyday, but some are photographs of Ted and John out in public that Donny clearly took himself. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa...  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, as you can see, you've been part of our family for quite some time. Welcome home.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heh, you know what's hilarious, I got tons of pictures of you guys at my house.  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, is he all mine?  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all yours, my little winner. You've arrived at a lucky time, Ted. It's almost Robert's play hour.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm guessin' you guys don't have a PS3. I'm guessin' you're more of a wooden horse with a wig kinda family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is led into Robert's room. It's a fairly sparse room with some toys strewn about. A wooden rocking horse with a wig stands in the corner.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Wig horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert sits down on the floor, smiling at him. Donny stands in the doorway. (CONTINUED) 105 CONTINUED:  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, remember, Ted, you belong to Robert now. So you will do as he says.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know, you think you're just gonna get away with a kidnapping? Nice fuckin' example you're settin' for your kid.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaning in to Ted with ANGER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted flinches nervously. Donny moves back.  DONNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a little boy, I saw you on television. And I thought you were the most amazing, most wonderful thing I'd ever seen. Ever. And I asked my father if I could have a magical teddy bear, too. And he said no. And I was heartbroken. I decided that if I ever had a son, I would never say no to him.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe "no" to a Snickers bar every once in awhile wouldn't hurt.  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Ted are gonna be best friends, daddy.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. You are. Happy play time. Donny shuts the door. Robert stares at Ted.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus fucking Christ!  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Daddy said no bad words!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, fuck your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted scrambles for the window and tries to open it. It doesn't budge. He takes a running leap at it, but just bounces off like a plush toy, and lands on the floor.  TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  (CONTINUED) 106 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert stands over him.  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said a bad word one time, and daddy punished me for it.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great story, I felt like I was there.  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy gave me an ouch. Now I have to give you an ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert grabs Ted with one hand, and gets a grip on one of Ted's ears with the other hand. Robert pulls on the ear as hard as he can, and rips the ear off. Ted screams as loud as he can. Robert looks at him, holding the ear.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... okay, kid. You win. We'll do it your way. You wanna play a game or somethin'? It's play time, let's play a game.  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I wanna play a game!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good, hey, how `bout we play a little game of hide and seek?  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love hide and seek! I'll hide!  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now, Robert, your dad likes you to show good manners, right?  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, a well-mannered kid lets his guest hide first, don't ya think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a beat. Robert stares blankly at him, then:  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you hide first.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Fantastic. Okay, now you count to a hundred and then try to find me, okay? (CONTINUED) 107 CONTINUED:  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I need to wash my hands before this game?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... well-- no, you-- god, that's a weird fuckin' question, no, just start countin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert sits down, covers his eyes and starts counting.  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... two... three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted grabs a chair and starts sliding it over toward the door. TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, no peekin', now, or you'll get kid cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted reaches the door, climbs up onto the chair, and turns the doorknob. He opens the door, and exits out into the hallway. After a beat, he re-enters, grabs his severed ear, and exits again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted nervously moves down the hallway toward the front door. He has it in sight on the far end of the living room, but when he gets closer to the living room doorway, he sees that Donny is sitting in an armchair, watching The Incredible Hulk (the old TV show). Ted darts back into the hallway before he's seen, but in the process, bumps into a small table with a lamp and a couple knick knacks on it. One of them, a small ceramic penguin, falls over, making a sound. Donny turns and looks in the direction of the hallway.  DONNY (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert? How's play time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert's hands still cover his eyes.  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, daddy! 108

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, are you making friends with Robert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted looks panicky, not knowing what to do. After a beat, Donny leans forward as if he's about to get up.  DONNY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted?

dialogues.speaker: ROBERT, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Daddy, you're gonna ruin the game!  DONNY (CHUCKLING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Ted breathes a sigh of relief, and walks the other way down the hall. He passes a door. He opens it, but it's just a storage closet. He's about to shut it, but notices a stapler amidst the odds and ends. He hastily begins stapling his ear back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny's hears something, and turns to look. We think he's about to get up, but he then settles back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE BACK ON TED, who puts on last staple in. Satisfied, he exits the closet and continues down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted looks around, and spots a phone on the counter. He jumps up, grabs the handset, and jumps back down. He dials John's number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is walking back to the Midtown Hotel. After a beat, Lori's car pulls up slowly alongside him. She leans over.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   (CONTINUED) 109 CONTINUED:  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kinda late to be walkin' home by yourself.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'll be okay. If I get raped, it'll be my fault with what I'm wearing.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, John... there's something I wanna say to you, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses, then gets into the car and sits down next to her. She prepares to speak, but John's phone rings. He shuts it off without looking at it.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted nervously holds the phone to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, I just want you to know that... I mean, I hope you don't think that--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's phone rings. He looks down at it, annoyed. It reads "Unknown caller." He silences it.  LORI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, um... I just feel like we should... keep talking. Because--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's phone rings again. Exasperated, he answers it.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoever this is, it's not a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT BACK & FORTH BETWEEN TED AND JOHN:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John! It's me! Can you hear me?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori sighs, slightly annoyed.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I gotta call you back. (CONTINUED) 110 CONTINUED:  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, John! Don't hang up, I'm in trouble!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, what kinda trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori turns, slightly curious, but still annoyed.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got me! That freaky guy and his freaky fat kid!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in their house, John! You gotta call the police, they won't let me outta here! They tore my ear off!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, slow down! Where are you?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... I'm not sure, it's uh--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, a hand grabs the phone away from Ted. He gasps and looks up. It's Donny, who slams the phone back down in its cradle.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dark, brewing rage) You're not a very polite guest.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted? Ted? Hello? Ted!  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, is he all right?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, but he's in trouble. (CONTINUED) 111 CONTINUED:  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? What happened? Can you call him back?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's blocked-- wait a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John scrambles for his wallet. He opens it, and pulls out the address given to him earlier by Donny at the Common. He looks at it, then points out the window.  JOHN (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Take Columbus to Herald and get on the expressway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's car peels out and races off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny stands over Ted.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've put us in a pickle here, haven't you? We have to go now.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted runs through Donny's legs, and out into the hall. He races for the living room and the exit, but Robert steps in front of the door, blocking him. TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aaaa!  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert turns the deadbolt on the door, locking it. Ted turns and bolts in the other direction back down the hallway, but sees Donny heading for him. Ted ducks into the dining room, as Donny lunges for him and misses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny pursues Ted around the table. Ted ducks under the table, under the chairs, etc. trying to escape Donny (and Robert, who has entered the room). Ted slips past them and back out into the hall.  (CONTINUED) 112 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He races for the door, but the deadbolt is too high to reach. He runs into the living room, and pushes open a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted tumbles down the dark stairs into the basement, which is lit only by a single bulb hanging from the ceiling. He lands, gets his bearings, then freezes in shock, as he sees that the basement is loaded with ripped and mutilated teddy bears.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny and Robert move in to frame behind him. DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We tried to make do with other teddy bears. But none of them were you, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted whirls around in shock, as we cut to:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori race through the streets of Boston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's this creepy fucked-up guy who wants Ted for his creepy fucked-up son. They got him somehow. LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way?  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot up 99!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car makes a hard left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John finishes punching numbers into his cellphone.    (CONTINUED) 113 CONTINUED:  JOHN (INTO PHONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, 911? I need the police right away! This guy took my teddy bear! (BEAT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's car speeds away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny and Robert emerge from the house. Donny clutches the sack. We can see it move as Ted struggles to get free. Robert gets in the back seat of the car as Donny opens the way back door, and dumps Ted inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted tumbles out of the sack and into the way back. Donny slams the door. He gets into the car.  DONNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert, seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert buckles up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny pulls away down the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted scrambles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks around frantically, then spots something out of the passenger's side window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN'S POV - They pass the alley, where we see Donny's car heading out of the alleyway.  JOHN (TO LORI)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa whoa, stop stop stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car slows down, and John sees Donny's car make the turn out onto the street. Ted is looking out the back. 114

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert and Donny both hear this. Donny looks in his side- view mirror, just in time to see Lori's car swing a U- turn to pursue them. Donny speeds up, and races off up the street. Lori's car speeds up in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do several quick cuts as the chase blasts its way through the Boston streets, avoiding traffic and pedestrians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny's car races through the tunnel. Lori's car pursues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted continues to stare out the back. He then notices a crowbar on the floor in the way back. He grabs it, and takes a hard swing at the rear window. It does not break. Robert sees this, and scrambles to undo his seat belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, we're losing him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted takes another swing at the window. The glass does not break. Robert undoes his seat belt, and scrambles back. He grabs Ted, who drops the crowbar. He starts to pull Ted back over into the back seat, but Ted manages to wriggle free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chase continues. 115

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted grabs the crowbar, and again takes a swing at the window. This time, it shatters. He drops the crowbar, and climbs up onto the edge of the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They see Ted in the window.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get closer!  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted gets one leg and one arm up onto the edge of the window, when suddenly he is whacked hard in the side of the head, sending him tumbling onto the floor. We see that Robert has struck him hard with the crowbar.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding head in pain) Aaaaa! Shit!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue watch with held breath, as they keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted shakes himself off, still a little dazed, and climbs back up. Robert climbs into the way back and grabs one of his legs.  ROBERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! You're being bad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted reaches down and grabs the crowbar with one arm, and brandishes it threateningly at Robert.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back off, Susan Boyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robert backs off in fear. Ted climbs out onto the rear of the car, and positions himself to make the jump. He tosses the crowbar away into the tunnel. John and Lori speed up, getting closer to him, so he can make the jump. 116

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy...  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  JOHN EASY--  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's car moves closer to Donny's. There's a tense moment with some back and forth cutting... and then Ted makes the jump! He lands on the hood of Lori's car, and slides across, grabbing the windshield wiper to avoid falling off. He pulls himself back up. John and Lori breathe energetic sighs of relief.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny! Total T.J. Hooker, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori laugh.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Fuckin' A right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny sees what's happening in his side mirror. He puts his foot on the brakes, and the car screeches as it drastically reduces speed. John's car slams into Donny's causing Ted to go flying back through open rear window of Donny's car, past Robert (who is still in the way back) and tumbling into the back seat.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God dammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted gets his bearings, and notices the sack that Donny captured him in, lying on the floor. He looks up at Donny for a beat, then grabs the sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Donny driving. Suddenly, Ted jumps up from behind, and throws the sack over Donny's head, bracing himself against the back of the front seat. Donny yells in anger, and pulls at Ted, trying to get him off. 117

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny's car scrapes against the side of the tunnel, sending sparks flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny grabs Ted and flings him off his face, onto the floor on the passengers' side. Donny rips the sack off his head, and reacts as he looks out the front window. He's approaching the end of the tunnel, and there is opposing traffic moving in the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny swerves past the traffic, narrowly avoiding clipping one of the cars. A moment later, John and Lori come racing out of the tunnel. However, a truck drives through the intersection, stopping them in their tracks.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pounds on the steering wheel, frantically willing the truck to get out of the way. Finally it does, and they continue on into the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny's car races through the streets, pursued by John and Lori, who are catching up again, but are still a ways behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is still on the floor on the passenger's seat side. He looks around, and spots a "Club" underneath the seat. He glances at Donny, whose eyes are on the road. Ted grabs the club, and scrambles up the seat, taking a swing at Donny. Donny ducks out of the way, and tries to slap Ted away as Ted continues to takes swings at him. A few of them land, eventually drawing blood. Donny smacks Ted away. Ted tumbles back onto the passenger's seat. Then, with determination, he grabs the Club again, scurries in front of Donny, and locks the Club onto the steering wheel with a snap! Donny's eyes widen as Ted scrambles into the back seat. Donny tries to turn the wheel, but can't. 118

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny's car swerves out of control, veering up the street, and crashing into a lamppost, fishtailing as it impacts. The airbags go off as the car comes to a stop. Taking advantage of the situation, Ted scrambles out the back window. He catches his fur on a jagged shard of glass, slightly ripping his side. He hangs and struggles for a bit, then drops to the ground. He sways a bit. TED'S POV - We see that his vision is swimming slightly. That little rip has done something... He shakes it off, and runs up the sidewalk. ANGLE ON DONNY, who scrambles out of the wrecked car, followed by Robert. They chase Ted up the street. Ted spots a garage with the door slightly open. He squeezes himself underneath, and disappears inside. ANGLE ON JOHN AND LORI - They screech to a stop behind Donny's car. They hurry out, just in time to see Donny and Robert duck underneath the door. They run up the sidewalk after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted runs down a ramp, looking frantically around for an escape route. He darts off to the left, sprinting up a ramp, followed by Donny and Robert. Ted stops at a red metal fence, and squeezes through, rushing up the stairs on the other side. Donny reaches the fence, but with his larger size he has to climb over the top, which slows him down a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON JOHN AND LORI - We catch them ducking in through the garage door, and running inside. They look around for a beat. ANGLE ON ROBERT, who turns and sees them (Donny has already made it over the fence). ANGLE BACK ON JOHN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori turn just in time to see Robert charging at them!  ROBERT (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't have my teddy bear!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Robert reaches John, John knocks him down with one punch to the face. Robert collapses. Lori and John look down at him.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.  (CONTINUED) 119 CONTINUED:  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, someone had to go Joan Crawford on that kid. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori run up the ramp, leaving a stunned Robert behind. When they reach the red fence, they look around, but it's unclear which way Ted and Donny have gone. John continues up the ramp (in the wrong direction) with Lori just behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted runs as fast as his stubby legs will carry him. Donny is in pursuit, and getting closer. The chase moves past a concession area, and up a few flights of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted runs out onto the upper level, and stops. The camera PIVOTS 180 DEGREES and ascends to reveal the expanse of FENWAY PARK down below. A few lights are on, and one lone maintenance man sweeps the dirt. Donny emerges from the stairwell, which snaps Ted out of it. Ted sprints past the front row of seats, and comes to a dead end. He has nowhere else to go. With Donny closing in, Ted scurries out onto the ledge, and pulls himself up onto the lighting tower. He looks down. From TED'S POV, it's a long drop. Donny reaches out to grab him, but can't quite reach. Donny glances down at the drop for a beat, then pulls himself out onto the ledge to go after Ted. Ted climbs farther up the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori emerge and continue to look around frantically. They run up the walkway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny pursues Ted up the tower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori emerge into the lower seating section, and run down the aisle, looking around with desperation.    (CONTINUED) 120 CONTINUED:  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spotting the action on the TOWER)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns and sees the drama playing out on the distant lighting tower.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus... (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, John! What are you--  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and runs back up the aisle, toward the concession area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is starting to gain ground, but he slips, and falls back down. He's about to pulls himself up again, when Donny grabs one of his legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John continues up the aisle as fast as he can move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted struggles to pull himself from Donny's grasp, but he can't. CLOSE UP ON TED'S SIDE - The small rip from earlier begins to tear again. CLOSE UP ON TED'S FACE - His eyes go wide, and for a moment, his face freezes with fear. TED'S POV - His vision swims a bit more. He knows this is not good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John reaches the top of the lower seating area, and sprints past the concession bar, heading for the stairs. 121

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The struggle continues. As Ted tries to pull himself free, the rip gets bigger. He reacts again, and again we see his vision swimming even more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John runs up the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The struggle continues. Ted tries to pull himself up, but he's visibly weakened and his hands are slipping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John continues up the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted manages to pull free from Donny. He uses all his depleted strength to pull himself farther up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John runs past the top of the stairwell, and sprints over toward the lighting tower, just in time to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donny makes one final reach for Ted. He grabs Ted by the foot again, and pulls hard. With one great RRRIIIIIIP, Ted tears into two pieces. As John watches in shock, Ted falls through the air in SLO-MOTION, a shower of white stuffing descending with him. Lori watches with a hand over her mouth. The two halves of Ted land, along with the scattered white stuffing. Donny, still hanging, stares down at the fallen teddy bear. He starts pulling himself back over the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lead and follow John as he runs back down through the stadium with desperate numbness. Lori climbs over the edge of the seating area, and runs toward him as well. ANGLE BACK ON DONNY, who pulls himself back over into the upper seating area. He hears the sound of a cop siren, and peers over the edge of the stadium. Seeing a cop car pull up far below, he makes a break for it.  (CONTINUED) 122 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below, Ted's top half lies on the grass, looking around in a daze, like a badly wounded soldier for whom there is not much hope. John and Lori race to his side, and kneel down.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted!  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...   TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak, slow breathing) Johnny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted looks glassy-eyed for a beat. John starts to frantically gather up the chunks of stuffing.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori, get the stuffing! Get it all!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori starts helping him, desperately grabbing chunks of the white cotton.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John leans back over Ted.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be okay, buddy. you understand? You're gonna be fine.  TED (WEAK)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I look like the robot from "Aliens".  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, look at me, buddy. I promise, you're gonna be okay.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I don't think so. I'm... I'm in trouble. I need... I need to tell you something.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't... don't ever lose her again. She's the most important... most important part of your life. (MORE) (CONTINUED) 123 CONTINUED: TED (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even more than me. She's your thunder buddy now. She's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted closes his eyes... and dies. ANGLE DIRECTLY ABOVE TED as we pull away, and it starts to rain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rain is pouring now. Lori's car pulls up. She and John hurry out, John holding the remains of Ted. They race inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori burst in with the remains of Ted. They're both drenched from the rain. Lori frantically searches drawers for sewing materials. She finds a needle and thread, and John puts Ted on the table. Lori starts to sew him up as John watches intently.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John... I don't know if this is gonna--  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just try. Please. Just try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She continues sewing, until she is all finished. They wait. Ted still does not move. John and Lori lower their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits on the couch, head in hands. Ted still lies on the coffee table. Lori enters with a blanket, and drapes it around him. She sits down next to him, bringing part of the blanket around herself. She places a hand on his shoulder.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John... I'm sorry. You did everything you could. I'm... I'm just so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gently puts an arm around him. There is a thunderclap outside. John does not react.  LORI (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost too softly to be HEARD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not afraid...    (CONTINUED) 124 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON TED (shortly after) as a white sofa blanket is placed over him. John and Lori shut off the lights, and exit...  DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is asleep, but we see that Lori is still lying awake. She sighs restlessly, and gets up. She walks over to the window, and looks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE UPWARD - We see a cloudy sky, much like the one from that night when John was a child. As before, there is a small clear patch in the center. A shooting star whizzes by through the opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lori's eyes widen a bit in recognition. She stares at the shooting star for a beat, then closes her eyes and makes a wish...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John wakes up, looks around groggily, then remembers. He gets out of bed, and walks toward the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses for a beat... and walks in. The blanket is where it was left. John slowly removes it. Ted is still motionless. John lowers his head sadly. Suddenly, Ted's eyes snap open.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted!  TED (RETARDED-SOUNDING VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alive, Johnny!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god!  (CONTINUED) 125 CONTINUED:  TED (RETARDED-SOUNDING VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alive! Your magical wish worked!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're back!  TED (RETARDED-SOUNDING VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! I mean, when you sewed me up, you put some of the stuffing in the wrong places, so I'm a little fucked up. Will you take care of me forever and ever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John stares at him, confused.  TED (CONT'D) (NORMAL VOICE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I'm just kiddin' ya, I thought it'd be funny if you thought I was fuckin' retarded.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asshole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John grabs him and hugs him. Lori enters. She sees what's happening, and a huge smile crosses her face.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome back, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns to Lori, and realizes...  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It... it was you. You did it. (cover this line with addition:) It was your wish.  TEDDY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling, speechless) Son of a bitch...You wished for my life back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at him.  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I wished for my life back. Because I love you both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John goes to her, and kisses her passionately.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were pretty great out there at Fenway, Johnny.  (CONTINUED) 126 CONTINUED:  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's my big brave man.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, do you know how awesome it was punching a kid? I felt so powerful! I mean if that's what it's like to hit a woman, watch out, I liked it.  LORI (SMILING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, too. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, I want you to know that... I'm probably never gonna be any more than a guy who rents cars, but... I don't care. You're the only thing that matters in my life.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: AY--  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You and Ted.

dialogues.speaker: TED, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes!  JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after last night, I... I don't ever want to lose anyone who matters to me ever again. I'm not gonna wait any longer for my life to start. Lori... will you marry me?  LORI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, she smiles) That's all I ever wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori kiss as we pull away...

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And so John, Lori, and Ted lived happily ever after, having discovered at last that all they really needed was each other. John and Lori were married in a beautiful ceremony in Cambridge, by a very special Justice of the Peace. 127

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the Flash Gordon Wedding March as we ANGLE ON Sam J. Jones standing in robes at the altar. Ted, in a tux, stands in the best man's position. John stands on the steps smiling and looking out as we cut to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON Lori, walking down the aisle in a wedding dress, smiling warmly. TIME CUT to shortly after, as Sam Jones addresses the two of them, standing at the altar.  SAM JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I now pronounce you man and wife. You may kiss the bride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori kiss each other. They turn and wave to the cheering crowd. Ted waves happily to John, who waves back. John and Lori run down the aisle joyfully, passing pews full of people from the movie: Lori's co-workers, John's co-workers, (Guy sitting with HIS BOYFRIEND, Alix and Tanya, etc.).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Lori come running out of the church, as the crowd throws rice at them. They run to a waiting limo with a "Just Married" sign on the back. John gets in, and Lori turns to throw the bouquet toward Gina, Michelle, Tracy, and Tanya. Tanya catches it. She turns and smiles at Alix. Then suddenly, Tami-Lynn bursts into frame, punching Tanya in the jaw. Tanya goes down as Tami-Lynn tackles her, and the crowd tries to pull her off. ANGLE ON the limo as it pulls away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted stands next to Sam J. Jones, watching with a smile as his best friend heads off.  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'know Sam, there's only one way to end a perfect day.  SAM JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?   TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On three.  SAM JONES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What on three?  TED

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flash jump.  (CONTINUED) 128 CONTINUED:  SAM JONES (REALIZING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One... two... three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWNSHOT Ted and Sam Jones leap into the air at the same time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They freeze frame in mid-air, as the Flash Gordon theme kicks in. Over the music:

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And that's the story of how one magical wish forever changed the lives of three very special friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: footage of Ted and Tami-Lynn from their double date.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ted and Tami-Lynn continued their torrid love affair for quite some time. One afternoon Ted was caught behind the deli counter eating potato salad off of Tami- Lynn's bare bottom. He was instantly promoted to store manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: footage of Sam Jones, walking toward John in slow motion.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sam Jones moved back to Hollywood with the goal of restarting his film career. He currently resides in Burbank where he shares a studio apartment with his roommate Brandon Routh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: photo of BRANDON ROUTH.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Remember Brandon Routh from that god- awful "Superman" movie? Jesus Christ. Thanks for getting our hopes up and taking a giant shit on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: footage or Rex at the office.     (CONTINUED) 129 CONTINUED:

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Rex gave up his pursuit of Lori. Not long after he fell into a deep depression and died of Lou Gehrig's disease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: footage of Donny dancing in his living room.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Donny was arrested by Boston police and charged with kidnapping a plush toy. The charges were dropped when everyone realized how completely stupid that sounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: footage of Robert, talking to Ted in his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: NARRATOR, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Robert got a trainer, lost a substantial amount of weight, and went on to become Taylor Lautner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSERT: photo of TAYLOR LAUTNER.    THE END
